block.p: Meredith Lauren Lane, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard S. Lane of New York, was married last evening to Bryan Scott Verona, a son of Jane R. Kornblut of Highland Park, Ill., and Dr. Steven R. Verona of Chicago. Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein officiated at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York.

The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. Mrs. Verona, 24, received a master's degree in English education from Columbia University, where Mr. Verona, 26, has just completed his first year in the M.B.A. degree program.

Meredith Lauren Lane, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard S. Lane of New York, was married last evening to Bryan Scott Verona, a son of Jane R. Kornblut of Highland Park, Ill., and Dr. Steven R. Verona of Chicago. Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein officiated at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York.

The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania. Mrs. Verona, 24, received a master's degree in English education from Columbia University, where Mr. Verona, 26, has just completed his first year in the M.B.A. degree program.

The bride is a learning specialist at the Dwight School in New York. Her father is the president of the Olnick Organization, a real estate development company in New York. Her mother is a partner in Artes Magnus, a New York company that commissions limited-edition art- works.

The bridegroom's mother is a senior vice president in the Highland Park office of R. D. Kushnir & Company, a financial advisory firm. His father retired as an oral and maxillofacial surgeon at Associates for Oral Surgery in Chicago. The bridegroom's stepmother, Arlene J. Verona, is an associate in the Chicago office of Van Slyck & Associates, a health-care consulting firm. His stepfather, Daniel W. Kornblut, is the principal of the Elm Place Middle School in Highland Park.
